citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A Routine inspection was conducted of two female reindeer at Thanksgiving Point, Lehi, UT on Dec 10, 2024. No itinerary
has been submitted for these animals that are residing at Thanksgiving Point during the "Luminaria" exhibit that runs from
Nov 14, 2024, through Jan 4, 2025. The two reindeer had been residing at Thanksgiving Point since the exhibit opened.
Two reindeer from the licensee's herd were also observed at the licensee's Christmas tree lot at 8995 S. State St., Sandy,
UT.
Itinerary submission is important so that animals can be inspected at offsite locations to ensure appropriate animal
welfare and compliance with the Animal Welfare Act.
For exhibition of animals at a site other than the approved site and when the animals will stay at that location overnight, a
written itinerary must be submitted to the USDA APHIS Animal Care Deputy Administrator at least 48 hours before
departure.
To be corrected by close of business on 12/15/2024.
This inspection was conducted at Thanksgiving Point, Lehi, UT (2 animals).
The exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A Routine inspection was conducted of two female reindeer at Thanksgiving Point, Lehi, UT on Dec 10, 2024. No itinerary 
has been submitted for these animals that are residing at Thanksgiving Point during the "Luminaria" exhibit that runs from 
Nov 14, 2024, through Jan 4, 2025. The two reindeer had been residing at Thanksgiving Point since the exhibit opened. 
Two reindeer from the licensee's herd were also observed at the licensee's Christmas tree lot at 8995 S. State St., Sandy, 
UT. 
 
Itinerary submission is important so that animals can be inspected at offsite locations to ensure appropriate animal 
welfare and compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
For exhibition of animals at a site other than the approved site and when the animals will stay at that location overnight, a 
written itinerary must be submitted to the USDA APHIS Animal Care Deputy Administrator at least 48 hours before 
departure. 
 
To be corrected by close of business on 12/15/2024. 
 
This inspection was conducted at Thanksgiving Point, Lehi, UT (2 animals). 
The exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
